processedFOF Class¶

A class to concatenate and compile all the post processed properties of the obejcts

If bounded objects needed, must have chunked bounded files located at:

USER_PATH/bounded2

where USER_PATH is the directory of the process-fof ouput.

class concatenateclass.processedFOF(snapnum, directory, sv, path='../../FOF_project', verbose=True, maxidx=300, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

accessBounded(arr)[source]¶

returns the array but only of systems which are bounded

Parameters

arr (Numpy.ndarray) – array to crop

Returns

array with only the bounded indices

Return type

Numpy.ndarray

accessBoundedComplete(arr)[source]¶

This function can be used when the chunking hasn’t finished running to ensure that only systems with a known bounded calculation are being used

Parameters

arr (Numpy.ndarray) – array to crop

Returns

array with only the bounded completed indices

Return type

Numpy.ndarray

addEnvironment()[source]¶

Search for environment output and add to properties. Must be run post bounded! Only available for baryonic primaries.

calcMUV()[source]¶

Calculates absolute uv magnitude

Sets:

self.parameters[‘SFR’] (arr): star formation rates self.M_uv

chopResolutionHalos(cutoff=300)[source]¶

if the list contains DM halos beyond the resolution limit, chop them off

chopUnBounded()[source]¶

For all the parameters in self.properties, removes all unbounded objects

Returns

None

chopUnfinished()[source]¶

For all the parameters not calculated in the bounded script, removes the indices of the objects which do not have a bounded calculation.

Returns

None

setupCosmo()[source]¶

Calculates relevant cosmology properties. ASSUMES SNAPS ARE SEPARATED BY 1 redshift!!!!!!

Sets:

self.deltat (float): elapsed time since last snapshot in years
